business.headline: Muhurat Trading 2024: Check timings, stock recommendations, all key detailsMuhurat Trading today: The pre-opening session will begin at 5:45 PM, and all intraday positions will be automatically squared off 15 minutes before the session's close, necessitating careful planning for same-day trades.

Muhurat trading 2024: Check stock picks, trading strategy and expert insightsMuhurat trading is not just a unique market session; it's a cherished tradition where investors make token investments to invoke the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth.

Bibek Debroy dies at 69: A visionary economist and policy reformer Bibek Debroy's life was marked by significant contributions to economic policy and classical literature, shaping India's intellectual landscape and leaving a lasting impact on future generations.

19 kg LPG commercial cylinders to get costlier from today. Check pricesThe prices of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinders have been revised across the country, including in metro cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai, effective November 1.

Sensex ends over 550 points lower, Nifty dips as IT stocks slideThe S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 553.12 points to close at 79,389.06, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 135.50 points, settling at 24,205.35. Broader market indices also declined as volatility weighed on investor sentiment across Dalal Street.

Explained: Why Cipla share price surged up to 10% todayCipla share price: The stock rose by 9.88% to reach a day high of Rs 1,557.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  At 10:41 am, shares of Cipla were up 8.24% at Rs 1,534.25.

HDFC Bank's HDB Financial files Rs 12,500 crore IPO. Check detailsHDFC Bank, holding a 94.6% stake in HDB Financial, will sell shares worth up to Rs 10,000 crore, while HDB Financial plans to issue fresh shares totalling Rs 2,500 crore, as outlined in the filing.
Diwali fireworks missing from Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty fall The S&P BSE Sensex was down 199.13 points to 79,743.05 at 10:07 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 126 points to 24,340.85.

Paytm lights up Noida skies with dazzling Diwali drone showPaytm celebrated Diwali with a dazzling drone show at its Noida headquarters, featuring messages like "Happy Diwali" and "Paytm karo" in the night sky.

Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day rally as dull Q2 earnings disrupt momentum The BSE Sensex fell 0.5% to close at 79,966, while the NSE Nifty 50 index declined by the same margin to 24,350, as market sentiment weakened due to ongoing foreign selling and lacklustre corporate earnings.
StoxBox's Diwali picks: 5 stocks to light up your portfolioGet ready to brighten your portfolio this Diwali with these five promising stocks that are expected to deliver strong future performance.

Falling behind in AI race has cost Samsung $122 billion: Report Samsung has lost $122 billion in market value since July, a tumble of 32% that makes it the largest decline among global chipmakers this year.
Elcid's 66,92,535% surge makes it India's most expensive stock, surpassing MRFElcid Investments, based in Mumbai, is a non-banking financial company (NBFC) with a strong connection to Asian Paints.

Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports: Why Adani stocks are gaining todayAdani Enterprises shares rose 4.42% to Rs 2,974.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at 11:41 am, while APSEZ saw a 2.62% lift to Rs 1,408.65. All other Adani Group companies also traded in the green, supported by these positive cues.

RBI's 102-tonne gold haul this Dhanteras: What's behind the move?The RBI recently relocated 102 tonnes of gold from the Bank of England's vaults to secure facilities within India as it now hold a total of 855 tonnes in reserves.

Explained: Why Maruti Suzuki share price gained over 2% despite weak Q2 resultsMaruti Suzuki's quarterly report revealed a 17% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 3,103 crore, falling short of market expectations.

Sensex, Nifty in red as Q2 earnings dampen Diwali spirit; Adani stocks gainThe NSE Nifty 50 dropped 0.24% to 24,411.9 points, while the BSE Sensex declined 0.28% to 80,142.11 by 9:57 am. Seven out of the 13 major sectors showed losses, while small-cap and mid-cap indices performed better, rising 1% and 0.5%, respectively.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Afcons Infrastructure allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Afcons Infrastructure Day 3: Check latest subscription, GMP sees dip  The Afcons Infrastructure IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares valued at Rs 1,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.03 crore shares worth Rs 4,180 crore.

Muhurat trading 2024: Expert tips to maximise your Diwali returnsMuhurat trading is a unique session conducted by Indian stock exchanges on Diwali, rooted in the belief that this 'auspicious hour' is a time to attract prosperity.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Make poll promises you can keep: Congress chief raps Karnataka, cautions statesMallikarjun Kharge's remark came after the Congress-led Karnataka government said that it would review its 'Shakti' scheme that promises free bus rides to women.

I'm not your maal: Shaina NC slams rival Uddhav Sena MP's sexist remarkShiv Sena (UBT) MP Arvind Sawant stoked a controversy after he called Shaina NC "imported maal" after she quit the BJP and joined the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly election.

Pak collecting information on J&K's Chenab Bridge at China's behest: SourcesTrials recently began on the Chenab Bridge, the world's tallest railway bridge, which is expected to enhance connectivity between Jammu and Kashmir and the rest of the country.

Bibek Debroy, economist and PM Modi's economic council chief, dies at 69Bibek Debroy, widely recognised for shaping economic policies, is also known for his translations of classical Sanskrit texts, including the Mahabharata and the Gita.

Singham Again review: Singham roars but Simmba gets biggest kill in cop universeReleased-Fri Nov 01, 2024Rohit Shetty reimagines the Ramayan in his cop universe with Ajay Devgn as Bajirao Singham, offering a blend of humour, drama, and action. The film features a contemporary twist on the mythological tale with a star-studded cast and meta jokes. Read the full review.

Nude Lovers spring back, remind India of first 'obscene' art controversyThe Bombay High Court in October prevented the customs department from destroying paintings of Akbar Padamsee over "obscenity". It was Padamsee's nude paintings, Lovers 1 and 2, which was Independent India's first major art controversy. Seventy years on, the nude Lovers have returned to public consciousness.

Sedition case against 18 Hindus in Bangladesh over saffron flagsEighteen Hindus have been booked for sedition in Bangladesh over saffron flags being raised in Chattogram. Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, one of the Hindu leaders facing the sedition case, spoke exclusively to India Today Digital on how this is part of an agenda of targeting minorities.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 review: Kartik Aaryan delivers brave message in horror-comedyReleased-Fri Nov 01, 2024Kartik Aaryan's Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 is not just about horror or comedy, but it also holds an important message and tries to present it in the most sensitive way possible.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Delhi man, nephew shot dead on Diwali night, murders caught on CCTVDiwali celebrations turned tragic for a family when two armed men shot dead a 40-year-old man and his 16-year-old nephew at their home, while his 10-year-son was injured in Delhi.

Odisha man kills wife with help of 2 girlfriends after she learns of his affairsThe matter came to light when the accused took his wife to a Bhubaneswar hospital, claiming that she had attempted suicide. However, the post-mortem report and police investigation saw all the three accused being arrested.

Decoding Delhi's Diwali data: How 24-hour average hides real-time pollution peaksA detailed analysis by the monitoring stations across Delhi revealed that night-time pollution levels on Diwali were alarmingly high, with PM2.5 and PM10 particles soaring up to 30 times the standard limit.

Pics: Rashmika Mandanna celebrates Diwali with Vijay Deverakonda's familyRashmika Mandanna celebrated Diwali with Vijay Deverakonda's family. She shared her solo pictures, which were clicked by Anand Devarakonda.

PM Modi attends wedding of Surat-based diamond trader's son in Gujarat Dravya Dholakia and Janhvi's wedding was held at Het Ni Haveli in Gujarat's Dudhala. In the photos shared by the family, PM Modi can be witnessed blessing the newlyweds.

Digital arrest scam: How cybercriminals in Cambodia are defrauding IndiansSources in the Home Ministry's cyber wing said scammers were siphoning off approximately Rs 6 crore every day through digital arrest techniques. Southeast Asian countries such as Cambodia are the hotbed of these scams.
Odisha man uses Alexa to launch Diwali rocket in viral video. Here's how he did itAn Odisha man has gone viral on social media for launching a Diwali rocket with the help of Alexa.

India's silent epidemic: What's killing our students? Surging suicides in campuses, driven by relentless academic pressure and inadequate mental health support, expose the deep-rooted flaws in the educational and societal frameworks

Industrial alcohol: How Supreme Court made it 'happy hours' for statesThe 8:1 ruling will enable states to curb misuse of industrial alcohol and boost their revenue even as the dissenting judge has flagged regulatory and economic concerns

Amaran box office Day 1: Sivakarthikeyan records career-best openingAmaran, which released on October 31, registered a career-best opening for actor Sivakarthikeyan. The film earned over Rs 20 crore nett in India on its opening day.

On Singham Again release day, a look at contemporary films that explored RamayanaRohit Shetty's Singham Again, released on November 1, incorporateed Ramayana themes amidst a star-studded cast. Ajay Devgn, Kareena Kapoor, and others play roles inspired by the epic, adding a mythological twist to the narrative. Let's take a look at other films that have been inspired from the Ramayana.

Jennifer Lopez breaks down while chiding Trump: Want Hollywood ending for HarrisJennifer Lopez, who has been voicing her support in favour of the Democratic Presidential candidate, made her campaign trail debut at a rally in Las Vegas on Thursday night, calling it the "most important stage I've ever been on".

1 arrested for firing outside singer AP Dhillon's Canada home, another on the runThe arrested accused has been identified as 25-year-old Abjeet Kingra of Winnipeg, the police said, adding that he has been charged with "discharge of a firearm with intent and arson."

Donald Trump will fix this: Elon Musk on Perplexity AI CEO's green card delayElon Musk, underscoring that it had become hard for highly talented people to come to America legally, said Donald Trump would 'fix it' if he won the presidential election.

Sobhita Dhulipala finds her photo on firecracker cover, shares picActor Sobhita Dhulipala humorously discovered her photo on a firecracker cover and shared it with her fans. That's how she wished her fans on Diwali too.

Watch: Kartik Aaryan visits Siddhivinayak temple, clicks seflies with fansKartik Aaryan sought blessings at the Siddhivinayak temple in Mumbai today, November 1, which coincides with the release of his film Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3. The actor also complied with his fans, who eagerly walked up to him for selfies.

Kingdom: How a period K-Drama became the quintessential Korean apocalypse seriesThe Korean drama Kingdom, starring Ju Ji-hoon and Bae Doona, broke traditional zombie tropes by setting its narrative in the Joseon period. This unique historical drama is perfect blend of horror, survival, and political intrigue.

Aditi Rao-Siddharth share new wedding pics featuring Kamal Haasan, Mani RatnamAditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth shared throwback pictures from one of their wedding ceremonies. Kamal Haasan, Mani Ratnam, Suhasini and many others were seen in attendance.

sports.headline: Manjrekar lauds 'favourite cricketer' Jadeja after 14th 5-wicket haulFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar lauded Ravindra Jadeja for his brilliant performance in the first innings of the Mumbai Test match. Jadeja clinched his 14th 5-wicket-haul and helped India bowl out New Zealand for 235 runs.

Ravindra Jadeja equals Abdul Qadir in elite club with five-wicket haulIND vs NZ: Ravindra Jadeja finished with figures of 22-1-65-5 in the first innings of the Mumbai Test to help India bowl New Zealand out for 235 in 65.4 overs.

Suresh Raina on Rishabh Pant coming to CSK: 'He was with MS Dhoni in Delhi'Former Chennai Super Kings and India batter Suresh Raina hinted at the possibility of Rishabh Pant joining CSK after being released by Delhi Capitals ahead of IPL 2025.

Ravindra Jadeja becomes 5th highest wicket-taker for India in Test cricketRavindra Jadeja became India's fifth-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket during the first day of the third Test against New Zealand in Mumbai.

IND vs NZ: Umbrellas come out as Mumbai heat forces players to take extended breaksPlayers from India and New Zealand were seen having a tough time in the middle during the third Test at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai due to the scorching heat at the stadium.

AUS-A vs IND-A: Sudharsan, Padikkal and Mukesh star as India take 120-run leadSai Sudharsan and Devdutt Padikkal formed a formidable 178-run partnership to give India A a significant lead over Australia A in the unofficial Test in Mackay. Mukesh Kumar's stellar bowling performance earlier helped restrict Australia A to 195, setting the stage for India A's strong reply.

Rohit Sharma intervenes as Sarfaraz's antics riles up Mitchell, umpire warns playersIndia vs New Zealand, Mumbai Test: Rohit Sharma exchanged words with umpires when New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell grew visibly frustrated with Sarfaraz Khan's murmuring from his forward short-leg position.

World Test Championship: South Africa's ascent on table worrying sign for IndiaSouth Africa whitewashed Bangladesh away from home in the two-match Test series by 2-0 and have climbed to the fourth spot in the WTC Points Table.

Watch: N'Golo Kante wins hearts by cleaning up pitch during Al-Ittihad gameN'Golo Kante continues to win fans over with his humble actions. During Al-Ittihad's match against Al-Ahli, Kante cleared the pitch of flags thrown by fans, showcasing his sportsmanship.

Sundar continues to haunt Rachin, dismisses NZ batter for 3rd successive timeIndia off spinner Washington Sundar dismissed Rachin Ravindra for the third consecutive time in the ongoing series by shattering his stumps on Day 1 of the second Test in Mumbai.

Pat Cummins a doubt as Australia to tour Sri Lanka for 2 Tests and 1 ODIAustralia's cricket team is set to tour Sri Lanka in early 2025 for a series of two Tests and one ODI. Captain Pat Cummins might miss this tour as he expects the arrival of his second child.

Ruben Amorim remains tight-lipped on Manchester United links: Will talk about itSporting Lisbon's coach Ruben Amorim has chosen not to comment on speculations linking him to the Manchester United managerial position. Amorim is all set to replace Erik ten Hag as the new United manager, according to British media.

Mukesh Kumar's sensational 6 for 46 helps India A bowl Australia A out for 195Mukesh Kumar delivered a sensational performance for India A, stepping up as their key player by claiming six wickets to bowl out Australia A for 197 in the first innings.

AUS-A vs IND-A: Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad suffers twin failures in MackayIndia A captain Ruturaj Gaikwad's struggles persisted as he was dismissed for just 5 runs in the second innings against Australia A. Ruturaj was dismissed for a duck in the first innings.

LaLiga clubs to help raise money for victims of Spain's flash floodsLaLiga and its clubs have initiated a fundraising campaign to assist the Red Cross in relief efforts after the flash floods in Spain. The campaign will be highlighted during match broadcasts and on social media platforms to maximise support.

Siraj replaces Jasprit Bumrah as India rest star pacer for 3rd TestIndia vs New Zealand: Young pacer Mohammed Siraj has replaced Jasprit Bumrah for the third and final Test against New Zealand.

Rishabh Pant leaves Delhi Capitals after 8 seasons: Career in numbers in IPLIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant has been let go by Delhi Capitals (DC) ahead of the auction for the upcoming edition. The left-handed Pant played eight seasons for DC in the tournament.

1st ODI: West Indies hammer inexperienced England in series openerEvin Lewis played a commanding knock of 94 to guide West Indies to an eight-wicket win over England in the rain-affected first one-day international.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
